newsitem.title: CANADA: Bank of Canada sets reverses at 2.75 percent.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Canada sets reverses at 2.75 percent.

text.p: The Bank of Canada on Friday conducted a round of reverse repurchase agreements at 2.75 percent in the money market, dealers said.

The central bank intervened on money markets after the call loan or overnight lending rate was offered at the bottom of the bank's 2.75-3.25 percent target range, dealers said. "There's no bid. It's offered everywhere at three-quarters. With that in mind the Bank is just reinforcing its lower end of the range," said a trader at one bank-owned brokerage. "It's nothing to exciting, just more cash than what people need. They're just addressing that fact."
The dealer said the intervention was partly the result of one bank having having too much cash on hand.
The call loan rating was trading at 2.75 percent following the intervention, dealers said. The three-month cash bill was trading with a yield of 2.80 percent.
